meaning: A divine hero famous for strength.
Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare.
Greek god of the west wind.
Hero of Homer's Odyssey known for cunning.
Messenger god of trade and travel.
Goddess of agriculture and harvest.
God of the sea, earthquakes, and horses.
Goddess of the hunt and wilderness.
God of music, prophecy, and healing.
Goddess of love and beauty.
God of fire and metalworking.
Goddess of the hearth and domestic life.
Queen of the underworld and goddess of spring.
Leader of the first generation of Titans.
Judge of the dead in the underworld.
Mortal weaver transformed into a spider.
Hero who slew the Minotaur.
Hero who tamed Pegasus and slew Chimera.
Musician who tried to retrieve his wife from Hades.
Wife of Odysseus known for loyalty.
Wise centaur tutor of heroes.
God of medicine and healing.
Wife of Orpheus who died young.
Youth who flew too close to the sun.
Hero who slew Medusa.
First woman who opened a forbidden jar.
Youth who fell in love with his own reflection.
Inventor and father of Icarus.
King who imposed the labors on Hercules.
Father of Theseus and king of Athens.
Beautiful youth abducted by Zeus.
Queen of the Amazons.
Queen seduced by Zeus in swan form.
Tragic heroine who defied a king.
Youth who lost control of the sun chariot.
Nymph who detained Odysseus.
Sorceress who transformed men into animals.
Daughter of Minos who aided Theseus.
Goddess associated with magic and crossroads.
God of dreams and sleep.
Blind prophet of Thebes.
Pertaining to the Eleusinian mysteries.
Companion of Alexander linked to mythic heroism.
Legendary early king of Athens.
Wife of Agamemnon who plotted his death.
Ancient tragedian with mythic themes.
The Furies as kindly goddesses.
Titaness of memory.
Ugly soldier known for insolence.
Mythic queen who aided Argonauts.
Name borne by Hellenistic queens.
Orator associated with mythic narratives.
Ancient religious association of Greek tribes.
Family name referencing mythic Chimera.
Personification of primordial darkness.
Ancient lexicon of mythic terms.
Ancient author drawing on mythic biography.
Followers of Pythagoras blending myth and number.
Demeter's protégé who spread agriculture.
Wife of Socrates (referenced in classical lore).
